references.reason: This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a foundation model for image segmentation that is leveraged by the authors' AnyChange model for zero-shot change detection.

references.paper_title: A spatial-temporal attention-based method and a new dataset for remote sensing image change detection
references.reason: This paper is referenced multiple times and is among the most important as it is a crucial source for benchmark datasets (LEVIR-CD) and change detection methods.

references.paper_title: Asymmetric siamese networks for semantic change detection in aerial images
references.reason: This paper introduces the SECOND benchmark dataset which is used for evaluation in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Unsupervised deep change vector analysis for multiple-change detection in VHR images
references.reason: This paper is one of the foundational papers for unsupervised change detection, which is compared with the current work's zero-shot approach.
This foundational paper on layer normalization is important for understanding the normalization techniques used within SAM, which underlies AnyChange.
